item.title: Abandoned bike, 22nd June
item.description:
The moron who abandoned this particular forest bike not only left it on the pavement in an undesignated location. They chose the narrow part of the pavement to ensure that pedestrians had the most difficult time navigating their way around it. This illustrates that the kind of fools that use your service not only do not respect another human being on the planet. They don’t even respect your bikes get rid of the scheme immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Hatfields, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping. People using grit bin as a rubbish bon, 22nd June
item.description:
People are too stupid to understand the difference between a grit bin and a bin for rubbish. Please come and remove all the rubbish from the grit bin and possibly put padlocks on the grit bins so they are actually used for their intended purpose in the Winter only rather than these disgusting rubbish bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41-45, The Cut, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two mattresses and a fridge left on street in front of 8 West Grove, 22nd June
item.description:
The Coach House at the rear of 8 West Grove land is under offer and was being cleared out as its owner is not available or able to clear the house out. James removal company were responsible for the clear out of this house and should have removed all items. Instead they left these 3 items. The items have been on the street since Friday 13th June. I raised it with them last week but they gave vague excuses and were clearly not willing to come back and remove it but it is clear it was their responsibility to remove the items. The mattresses are even wrapped in their covers with James removal written on it. Dexters estate agent in Greenwich was also handing this removal on behalf of the seller.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-12, West Grove, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on grit bin, 22nd June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41-45, The Cut, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway collapsing, 22nd June
item.description:
I reported this issue (see 7377305) in April 2025 and need this dangerous pathway to be fixed. It is uneven and hazardous for people to navigate and is due to a gradual sinking of the ground along this pathway. Whether this is due to poor construction or other reasons I cannot say, but over the last 20 years it has gotten worse and is now unacceptable. My last report seems to have been unheeded, hence I am reporting it again as the main pathway adjacent to Beatson’s Walk is definitely within Southwark Council’s responsibility. Surely the summer is the time to fix it and not wait for an accident when the winter frost and ice will make walking here even more dangerous. Kind regards Teorin Kurg 15 Foundry Close, Se166ns

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foundry Close, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
